  • Constructor Details

    • MinesweeperUIBuilder

      public MinesweeperUIBuilder(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, GameSettings gameSettings)
      Constructor for initializing the UI Builder. A new Minesweeper and MouseEventHandler are created when the resetGame() method is called, which happens at program launch and when starting a new game.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage -
      gameSettings -

  • Method Details

    • updateMineCounter

      public void updateMineCounter(int numMines)

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver()

    • buildScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene buildScene()
      Build the Scene containing the main game layout.
      Returns:
      The Scene to be displayed.

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Start a new game and rebuild the grid using current game settings.

    • createCellButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button createCellButton()
      Helper method to create individual cell buttons and tell them what to do when you click on them.
      Returns:
      The newly created Button.

    • updateCellAppearance

      public void updateCellAppearance(javafx.scene.control.Button cellButton, Cell cell, boolean isLeftClick)
      Update the appearance of the cell after the user interacts with it.
      Parameters:
      cellButton - The button that was clicked.
      cell - The game cell that corresponds to that button.
      isLeftClick - Flag to determine whether the click was a left click or not.

    • buildStackPaneFromLeftClickOrDefault

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane buildStackPaneFromLeftClickOrDefault(javafx.scene.control.Button cellButton, Cell cell)
      Build the StackPane that results from a left click interaction (or no interaction, but you just started a new game). A StackPane consists of some (optional) text, an (optional) image, and the button, stacked on top of each other.
      Parameters:
      cellButton - The cell button that was clicked (or initialized). NOTE: This is not needed, but I'm leaving it in case it's needed in the future.
      cell - The corresponding game cell for that button.
      Returns:
      The newly built StackPane for your viewing pleasure.

    • buildStackPaneFromRightClick

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane buildStackPaneFromRightClick(javafx.scene.control.Button cellButton, Cell cell)
      Build the StackPane that results from a right-click interaction. The left-click method was getting large and complicated, so I pulled the right-click logic into its own method.
      Parameters:
      cellButton - The cell button that was clicked (or initialized). NOTE: This is not needed, but I'm leaving it in case it's needed in the future.
      cell - The corresponding game cell for that button.
      Returns:
      The newly built StackPane for your viewing pleasure.

    • startTimer

      private void startTimer()
      Make the timer start counting up so the user can see how many seconds have elapsed since game start. Timer should freeze at 999, or when the game is over. This code could potentially be moved into the model.Minesweeper class.

    • resetTimer

      public void resetTimer()
      Stop the timer, and reset it to 0.

    • updateTimerDisplay

      private void updateTimerDisplay(int seconds)
      Convert the elapsed time into text so the user can view it on screen.
      Parameters:
      seconds - The number of seconds elapsed so far in this game.
